title: No, this video does not show protests during Trump’s June 2019 visit to the UK
subtitle: A video of a huge protest in London has been viewed more than two million times in multiple posts on Twitter and Facebook which claim it was filmed during US President Donald Trump’s ongoing June 2019 visit to the UK. The claim is false; the video was captured from BBC footage of protests in London in July 2018, when Trump first visited the UK as US leader.
author: factcheck.afp.com
vclaim:
No, this video does not show protests during Trump’s June 2019 visit to the UK

A video of a huge protest in London has been viewed more than two million times in multiple posts on Twitter and Facebook which claim it was filmed during US President Donald Trump’s ongoing June 2019 visit to the UK. The claim is false; the video was captured from BBC footage of protests in London in July 2018, when Trump first visited the UK as US leader.

The one-minute clip was shared in this June 4, 2019 tweet.

It has been viewed more than 1.9 million times and retweeted more than 6,000 times.

The tweet’s caption states: “Aerial view of today's Anti-Trump protest London. Thousands of Protesters March down the Streets Of London against Trump's policies & recent Visit. I'm guessing this wasn't the Parade Trump was hoping for lol”.

Below is a screenshot of the misleading tweet:

Trump arrived in the UK on June 3, 2019. Here is an official British government press release announcing the state visit and here is an AFP report about his ongoing trip.

The same video was also shared on Twitter with a similar claim in this post published the same day.

The video has also been viewed thousands of times in Facebook posts with an identical or very similar claim, for example here, here and here.

The claim is false; the video has been captured from BBC footage of a different protest during Trump’s previous visit to the UK, in July 2018.

This video published on the BBC’s verified YouTube account on July 13, 2018, matches the video in the misleading Facebook and Twitter posts.

The 2018 video’s caption says: “Thousands of protesters are marching through central London in protest of Donald Trump's visit.”

The video is embedded below:

Below is a screenshot comparison of the video in the misleading posts (L) and the video on the BBC's YouTube channel (R):

The BBC video shows Regent's Street in London next to All Souls Church.

Below is the corresponding section of Regent's Street on Google Satellite view:

On July 13, 2018, tens of thousands of people marched through central London in a protest against Trump, as he visited the UK for the first time as US leader in July 2018. Here is an AFP article published on July 14, 2018 about those protests.

On June 4, 2019, thousands of people protested in London over Trump's state visit to the UK. Here is an AFP report about the demonstrations, which have also been covered by The Guardian here and the BBC here.

The BBC report dated June 4, 2019 is embedded below:
